bibl.title: In Re: Ex Parte - Turner Jackson Petitioner For A Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US District Court Western Division of Washington, Seattle

div1.p: United States of America, Ninth Judidical District, State of Washington, County of King. ss

R.S. Jones Attorney for the petitioner, Turner Jackson, respectfully certifies that he has prepared the foregoing Demurrer, and is familiar with the contents thereof, and that the same is well in point of law. R.S. Jones Attorney.

no. 1325. United States Ciruit Court, Western District of Washington. In re. Turner Jackson Habeas Corpus. Appearance Filed in the U.S. Circuit Court 190 Western Dist. of Washington. Sep 4 1905. Clerk A. Reeves Ayres, clerk. Wm. H Briker Dept. Deputy Clerk.
In The United States Ciruit Court, For the Ninth Juidicial Circuit, Western Division of the State of Washington, Northern Division.
In re. Parte: Turner Jackson, Petitioner, Stipulation.

It is herby stipulated and agreed, that, the Honorable C.H. Hanford, Judge of the above entitled Court, agreeing thereto, this matter shall be heard as of a final hearinb and as of the date of September 9th, A.D. 1905, upon the petitioner, writ, return, and demurrer herein, that the decision of said Court rendered thereon shall be fine and determinaive of the matters involved herein, and if the siad Court shalkl determine that the said Turner Jackson is unlawfully held upon said 9th day of September, A.D. 1905, as a prisoner in the penitentiary at McNeill's Island, that thereupon said prisoner shallbe immediately discharged without the necessity of further action or hearing thereupon. Jesse A Frye, United States Attorney. Wm. H. Briker, R. s. Jones, Attorneys for Turner Jackson.

no. 1325. United States Ciruit Court, Western District of Washington. In re. Turner Jackson Habeas Corpus. Appearance Filed in the U.S. Circuit Court 190 Western Dist. of Washington. Sep 4 1905. Clerk A. Reeves Ayres, clerk. Wm. H Briker Dept. Deputy Clerk.
In The United States Ciruit Court, For the Ninth Juidicial Circuit, Western Division of the State of Washington, Northern Division.
In re. Parte: Turner Jackson, Petitioner, No. 1325.

Comes now the United States Attorney for the Western Distrcit of Washington and duly excepts to the order of discharge made and entered in the above entitled matter on this 11th day of September 1905: for the reason and upon the grounds following, to-wit:
That said order of discharge is not supported by the law controlling in the premises.
That said order of discharge is not warranted by nor supported by the facts, nor by the law in the premises. Jesse A. Frye. United States Attorney.
Which exceptions are allowed this day. C.H. Hanford, Judge.
